name: stiflingly
content:
stiflingly adverb
(HOT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is extremely hot and unpleasant: It's stiflingly hot in here. Violent storms and stiflingly high temperatures can strain the equipment.
More examplesFewer examplesThe room was stiflingly hot.On a stiflingly hot night, he stayed cool by covering his head with a wet towel.Avoid June to mid-September when it can be stiflingly humid and rainy. The air was stiflingly still and hot.

stiflingly adverb
(LIMITING)
in a way that prevents something from happening: The writing should be readable, not stiflingly academic. Lauren is desperate for a reprieve from her stiflingly protective family.
More examplesFewer examplesThe current system is stiflingly rule-based.David was only too happy to escape from his rather stiflingly austere upbringing in the north of England.There's nothing more stiflingly conformist than youth culture.It's the story of a smart girl growing up in a tiny village and escaping its stiflingly circumscribed life.
